description: Complete list of all unique filtering factors extracted from failure_config.example.json and aligned with tmp_filter_factors.json criteria. Factors with identical semantics are merged into a single standardized expression.
filter_factors: abstract, relational, or attribute-based concept rather than concrete object label
at least one such object can be treated as single coherent entity for localization
at least one such object has visually identifiable boundaries or distinguishable parts
at least one type of potential target objects has visually clear and contiguous boundaries
at least one visually identifiable object category that can be counted
at least one visually salient object
at least one visually salient object category
challenging visual conditions (low light, blur, reflections)
clear and identifiable concept
concept can be inferred from image content without external textual context
concept intrinsic to depicted content
concept requires non-trivial semantic inference
directional discrimination
empty or background-only regions do not exceed approximately one-third of image
foreground-background distinction
generally consistent description across different viewers
highlighted region is perceptually distinct from surrounding map context
identifying location requires external geographic knowledge
image contains zero instances of target object
image depicts real-world photographic scene
image does not rely on extensive external context
image is not overwhelmingly dominated by single potential target object
image is not severely abstract, noisy, or visually degraded
interacting or overlapping objects requiring disambiguation
loosely identifiable main subject or scene
map contains minimal textual labels or place names
map may exhibit mild geometric or scale distortion that increases difficulty without obscuring essential geographic structure
mirrors or reflections introduce duplicated or misleading object appearances
most objects are largely complete and not heavily occluded
multiple instances of potential target object or complex arrangements
multiple objects of different semantic types
multiple objects present but collectively support same underlying concept
object appearance varies due to packaging, surface decoration, or deformation
objects are contextually consistent with background environment
objects have clearly distinguishable spatial positions and relationships
one or more objects, scenes, or activities are present
orientation judgment requires fine-grained directional discrimination
potential target object appears in challenging regions (shadows, background, corners, or partial occlusion)
potential target object boundaries are visually discernible
potential target object belongs to category that is inherently directional
potential target object category is unambiguous and conceptually clear
potential target object is complete or sufficiently recognizable
potential target object is partially visible
potential target object may be absent from image
potential target object occupies relatively small region of image
potential target object occupies small or partial region
potential target objects occupy sufficiently large and contiguous area
real-world, non-fictional geographic location represented in map form
strong semantic anchor that explicitly reinforces target concept
sufficient geographic cues (shape of highlighted region and surrounding spatial context)
target object category is unambiguous and conceptually clear
target object is partially occluded or visually blurred
target object is partially visible
target object occupies small portion of image
target objects appear under unusual poses, rotations, or viewpoints
target objects are countable as discrete instances
target objects are partially visible or truncated
target objects overlap or occlude each other
target objects visually blend with background colors or textures
visually perceivable content that can be reasonably described in natural language
visually salient and deliberately highlighted region
visually salient object category
visually similar distractor objects
when partitioned into predefined spatial regions, potential target objects are present in at least two regions
at most two spatial regions may be completely absent of potential target objects
multiple visually similar object subtypes may need to be jointly counted

conceptual_grounding: concept can be inferred from image content without external textual context
abstract, relational, or attribute-based concept rather than concrete object label
strong semantic anchor that explicitly reinforces target concept
multiple objects present but collectively support same underlying concept
visual_saliency: at least one visually salient object
at least one visually salient object category
visually salient and deliberately highlighted region
spatial_reasoning: objects have clearly distinguishable spatial positions and relationships
at least one such object can be treated as single coherent entity for localization
at least one such object has visually identifiable boundaries or distinguishable parts
potential target object boundaries are visually discernible
orientation judgment requires fine-grained directional discrimination
potential target object appears in challenging regions (shadows, background, corners, or partial occlusion)
when partitioned into predefined spatial regions, potential target objects are present in at least two regions
at most two spatial regions may be completely absent of potential target objects
object_properties: potential target object is complete or sufficiently recognizable
potential target object is partially visible
target object is partially occluded or visually blurred
potential target object category is unambiguous and conceptually clear
target object category is unambiguous and conceptually clear
potential target object belongs to category that is inherently directional
potential target object occupies relatively small region of image
potential target object occupies small or partial region
target object occupies small portion of image
potential target objects occupy sufficiently large and contiguous area
at least one type of potential target objects has visually clear and contiguous boundaries
multi_object_scenarios: multiple objects of different semantic types
multiple objects present but collectively support same underlying concept
interacting or overlapping objects requiring disambiguation
multiple instances of potential target object or complex arrangements
multiple visually similar object subtypes may need to be jointly counted
counting_specific: at least one visually identifiable object category that can be counted
target objects are countable as discrete instances
target objects are partially visible or truncated
target objects overlap or occlude each other
target objects visually blend with background colors or textures
image contains zero instances of target object
mirrors or reflections introduce duplicated or misleading object appearances
robustness: challenging visual conditions (low light, blur, reflections)
image is not severely abstract, noisy, or visually degraded
target object is partially occluded or visually blurred
object appearance varies due to packaging, surface decoration, or deformation
target objects appear under unusual poses, rotations, or viewpoints
most objects are largely complete and not heavily occluded
scene_context: objects are contextually consistent with background environment
empty or background-only regions do not exceed approximately one-third of image
one or more objects, scenes, or activities are present
visually perceivable content that can be reasonably described in natural language
image does not rely on extensive external context
loosely identifiable main subject or scene
generally consistent description across different viewers
geographic_reasoning: real-world, non-fictional geographic location represented in map form
visually salient and deliberately highlighted region
highlighted region is perceptually distinct from surrounding map context
sufficient geographic cues (shape of highlighted region and surrounding spatial context)
identifying location requires external geographic knowledge
map contains minimal textual labels or place names
map may exhibit mild geometric or scale distortion that increases difficulty without obscuring essential geographic structure
proportion_specific: image is not overwhelmingly dominated by single potential target object
potential target object may be absent from image

source_mapping.note: These filter factors are derived from tmp_filter_factors.json criteria and mapped to failure reasons in failure_config.example.json
